t: 1 Chronicles 1
The Family of Adam—Seth to Abraham
Adam,*p Seth, Enosh,
Cainan, Mahalalel, Jared,
Enoch, Methuselah, Lamech,
Noah, Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
The*p sons of Japheth were*i Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech, and Tiras.
The sons of Gomer were*i Ashkenaz, Diphath, and Togarmah.
The sons of Javan were*i Elishah, Tarshishah, Kittim, and Rodanim.
The*p sons of Ham were*i Cush, Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.
The sons of Cush were*i Seba, Havilah, Sabta, Raama, and Sabtecha. The sons of Raama were*i Sheba and Dedan.
Cush begot Nimrod; he began to be a mighty one on the earth.
Mizraim begot Ludim, Anamim, Lehabim, Naphtuhim,
Pathrusim, Casluhim (from whom came the Philistines and the Caphtorim).
Canaan begot Sidon, his firstborn, and Heth;
the Jebusite, the Amorite, and the Girgashite;
the Hivite, the Arkite, and the Sinite;
the Arvadite, the Zemarite, and the Hamathite.
The*p sons of Shem were*i Elam, Asshur, Arphaxad, Lud, Aram, Uz, Hul, Gether, and Meshech.
Arphaxad begot Shelah, and Shelah begot Eber.
To Eber were born two sons: the name of one was*i Peleg, for in his days the earth was divided; and his brother’s name was*i Joktan.
Joktan begot Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,
Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah,
Ebal, Abimael, Sheba,
Ophir, Havilah, and Jobab. All these were*i the sons of Joktan.
Shem,*p Arphaxad, Shelah,
Eber, Peleg, Reu,
Serug, Nahor, Terah,
and Abram, who is*i Abraham.
The sons of Abraham were*i Isaac and Ishmael.
The Family of Ishmael
These*p are*i their genealogies: The firstborn of Ishmael was*i Nebajoth; then Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam,
Mishma, Dumah, Massa, Hadad, Tema,
Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah. These were*i the sons of Ishmael.
The Family of Keturah
Now*p the sons born to Keturah, Abraham’s concubine, were*i Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak, and Shuah. The sons of Jokshan were*i Sheba and Dedan.
The sons of Midian were*i Ephah, Epher, Hanoch, Abida, and Eldaah. All these were the children of Keturah.
The Family of Isaac
And*p Abraham begot Isaac. The sons of Isaac were*i Esau and Israel.
The sons of Esau were*i Eliphaz, Reuel, Jeush, Jaalam, and Korah.
And the sons of Eliphaz were*i Teman, Omar, Zephi, Gatam, and*i Kenaz; and by*i Timna, Amalek.
The sons of Reuel were*i Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah.
The Family of Seir
The*p sons of Seir were*i Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah, Dishon, Ezer, and Dishan.
And the sons of Lotan were*i Hori and Homam; Lotan’s sister was*i Timna.
The sons of Shobal were*i Alian, Manahath, Ebal, Shephi, and Onam. The sons of Zibeon were*i Ajah and Anah.
The son of Anah was*i Dishon. The sons of Dishon were*i Hamran, Eshban, Ithran, and Cheran.
The sons of Ezer were*i Bilhan, Zaavan, and*i Jaakan. The sons of Dishan were*i Uz and Aran.
The Kings of Edom
Now*p these were*i the kings who reigned in the land of Edom before a king reigned over the children of Israel: Bela the son of Beor, and the name of his city was Dinhabah.
And when Bela died, Jobab the son of Zerah of Bozrah reigned in his place.
When Jobab died, Husham of the land of the Temanites reigned in his place.
And when Husham died, Hadad the son of Bedad, who attacked Midian in the field of Moab, reigned in his place. The name of his city was*i Avith.
When Hadad died, Samlah of Masrekah reigned in his place.
And when Samlah died, Saul of Rehoboth-by-the-River reigned in his place.
When Saul died, Baal-Hanan the son of Achbor reigned in his place.
And when Baal-Hanan died, Hadad reigned in his place; and the name of his city was Pai. His wife’s name was Mehetabel the daughter of Matred, the daughter of Mezahab.
Hadad died also. And the chiefs of Edom were Chief Timnah, Chief Aliah, Chief Jetheth,
Chief Aholibamah, Chief Elah, Chief Pinon,
Chief Kenaz, Chief Teman, Chief Mibzar,
Chief Magdiel, and Chief Iram. These were*i the chiefs of Edom.
1 Chronicles 2
The Family of Israel
These*p were*i the sons of Israel: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Zebulun,
Dan, Joseph, Benjamin, Naphtali, Gad, and Asher.
From Judah to David

The*p sons of Judah were*i Er, Onan, and Shelah. These*i three were born to him by the daughter of Shua, the Canaanitess. Er, the firstborn of Judah, was wicked in the sight of the Lord;*s so He killed him.
And Tamar, his daughter-in-law, bore him Perez and Zerah. All the sons of Judah were*i five.
The*p sons of Perez were*i Hezron and Hamul.
The sons of Zerah were*i Zimri, Ethan, Heman, Calcol, and Dara—five of them in all.
The*p son of Carmi was*i Achar, the troubler of Israel, who transgressed in the accursed thing.
The*p son of Ethan was*i Azariah.
Also*p the sons of Hezron who were born to him were*i Jerahmeel, Ram, and Chelubai.
Ram begot Amminadab, and Amminadab begot Nahshon, leader of the children of Judah;
Nahshon begot Salma, and Salma begot Boaz;
Boaz begot Obed, and Obed begot Jesse;
Jesse begot Eliab his firstborn, Abinadab the second, Shimea the third,
Nethanel the fourth, Raddai the fifth,
Ozem the sixth, and*i David the seventh.
Now*p their sisters were*i Zeruiah and Abigail. And the sons of Zeruiah were*i Abishai, Joab, and Asahel—three.
Abigail bore Amasa; and the father of Amasa was*i Jether the Ishmaelite.
The Family of Hezron
Caleb*p the son of Hezron had children by Azubah, his*i wife, and by Jerioth. Now these were her sons: Jesher, Shobab, and Ardon.
When Azubah died, Caleb took Ephrath as his wife, who bore him Hur.
And Hur begot Uri, and Uri begot Bezalel.
Now*p afterward Hezron went in to the daughter of Machir the father of Gilead, whom he married when he was*i sixty years old; and she bore him Segub.
Segub begot Jair, who had twenty-three cities in the land of Gilead.
(Geshur and Syria took from them the towns of Jair, with Kenath and its towns—sixty towns.) All these belonged*i to*i the sons of Machir the father of Gilead.
After Hezron died in Caleb Ephrathah, Hezron’s wife Abijah bore him Ashhur the father of Tekoa.
The Family of Jerahmeel
The*p sons of Jerahmeel, the firstborn of Hezron, were*i Ram, the firstborn, and Bunah, Oren, Ozem, and*i Ahijah.
Jerahmeel had another wife, whose name was Atarah; she was the mother of Onam.
The sons of Ram, the firstborn of Jerahmeel, were Maaz, Jamin, and Eker.
The sons of Onam were Shammai and Jada. The sons of Shammai were*i Nadab and Abishur.
And*p the name of the wife of Abishur was*i Abihail, and she bore him Ahban and Molid.
The sons of Nadab were*i Seled and Appaim; Seled died without children.
The son of Appaim was*i Ishi, the son of Ishi was*i Sheshan, and Sheshan’s son was*i Ahlai.
The sons of Jada, the brother of Shammai, were*i Jether and Jonathan; Jether died without children.
The sons of Jonathan were*i Peleth and Zaza. These were the sons of Jerahmeel.
Now*p Sheshan had no sons, only daughters. And Sheshan had an Egyptian servant whose name was*i Jarha.
Sheshan gave his daughter to Jarha his servant as wife, and she bore him Attai.
Attai begot Nathan, and Nathan begot Zabad;
Zabad begot Ephlal, and Ephlal begot Obed;
Obed begot Jehu, and Jehu begot Azariah;
Azariah begot Helez, and Helez begot Eleasah;
Eleasah begot Sismai, and Sismai begot Shallum;
Shallum begot Jekamiah, and Jekamiah begot Elishama.
The Family of Caleb
The*p descendants of Caleb the brother of Jerahmeel were*i Mesha, his firstborn, who was the father of Ziph, and the sons of Mareshah the father of Hebron.
The sons of Hebron were*i Korah, Tappuah, Rekem, and Shema.
Shema begot Raham the father of Jorkoam, and Rekem begot Shammai.
And the son of Shammai was*i Maon, and Maon was*i the father of Beth Zur.
Ephah,*p Caleb’s concubine, bore Haran, Moza, and Gazez; and Haran begot Gazez.
And the sons of Jahdai were*i Regem, Jotham, Geshan, Pelet, Ephah, and Shaaph.
Maachah,*p Caleb’s concubine, bore Sheber and Tirhanah.
She also bore Shaaph the father of Madmannah, Sheva the father of Machbenah and the father of Gibea. And the daughter of Caleb was*i Achsah.
These*p were the descendants of Caleb: The sons of Hur, the firstborn of Ephrathah, were*i Shobal the father of Kirjath Jearim,
Salma the father of Bethlehem, and*i Hareph the father of Beth Gader.
And*p Shobal the father of Kirjath Jearim had descendants: Haroeh, and*i half of the families*i of*i Manuhoth.
The families of Kirjath Jearim were*i the Ithrites, the Puthites, the Shumathites, and the Mishraites. From these came the Zorathites and the Eshtaolites.
The*p sons of Salma were*i Bethlehem, the Netophathites, Atroth Beth Joab, half of the Manahethites, and the Zorites.
And*p the families of the scribes who dwelt at Jabez were*i the Tirathites, the Shimeathites, and*i the Suchathites. These were*i the Kenites who came from Hammath, the father of the house of Rechab.
1 Chronicles 3
The Family of David
Now*p these were the sons of David who were born to him in Hebron: The firstborn was*i Amnon, by Ahinoam the Jezreelitess; the second, Daniel, by Abigail the Carmelitess;
the third, Absalom the son of Maacah, the daughter of Talmai, king of Geshur; the fourth, Adonijah the son of Haggith;
the fifth, Shephatiah, by Abital; the sixth, Ithream, by his wife Eglah.
These*ip six were born to him in Hebron. There he reigned seven years and six months, and in Jerusalem he reigned thirty-three years.
And these were born to him in Jerusalem: Shimea, Shobab, Nathan, and Solomon—four by Bathshua the daughter of Ammiel.
Also there*i were Ibhar, Elishama, Eliphelet,
Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia,
Elishama, Eliada, and Eliphelet— nine in*i all.*i
These*i were*i all the sons of David, besides the sons of the concubines, and Tamar their sister.
The Family of Solomon
Solomon’s*p son was*i Rehoboam; Abijah was*i his son, Asa his son, Jehoshaphat his son,
Joram his son, Ahaziah his son, Joash his son,
Amaziah his son, Azariah his son, Jotham his son,
Ahaz his son, Hezekiah his son, Manasseh his son,
Amon his son, and*i Josiah his son.
The sons of Josiah were*i Johanan the firstborn, the second Jehoiakim, the third Zedekiah, and the fourth Shallum.
The sons of Jehoiakim were*i Jeconiah his son and*i Zedekiah his son.
The Family of Jeconiah
And*p the sons of Jeconiah were*i Assir, Shealtiel his son,
and*i Malchiram, Pedaiah, Shenazzar, Jecamiah, Hoshama, and Nedabiah.
The sons of Pedaiah were*i Zerubbabel and Shimei. The sons of Zerubbabel were*i Meshullam, Hananiah, Shelomith their sister,
and Hashubah, Ohel, Berechiah, Hasadiah, and Jushab-Hesed—five in*i all.*i
The*p sons of Hananiah were*i Pelatiah and Jeshaiah, the sons of Rephaiah, the sons of Arnan, the sons of Obadiah, and the sons of Shechaniah.
The son of Shechaniah was Shemaiah. The sons of Shemaiah were*i Hattush, Igal, Bariah, Neariah, and Shaphat—six in*i all.*i
The sons of Neariah were*i Elioenai, Hezekiah, and Azrikam—three in*i all.*i
The sons of Elioenai were*i Hodaviah, Eliashib, Pelaiah, Akkub, Johanan, Delaiah, and Anani—seven in*i all.*i
1 Chronicles 4
The Family of Judah
The*p sons of Judah were*i Perez, Hezron, Carmi, Hur, and Shobal.
And Reaiah the son of Shobal begot Jahath, and Jahath begot Ahumai and Lahad. These were*i the families of the Zorathites.
These were*i the*i sons*i of*i the father of Etam: Jezreel, Ishma, and Idbash; and the name of their sister was*i Hazelelponi;
and Penuel was*i the father of Gedor, and Ezer was*i the*i father of Hushah. These*p were*i the sons of Hur, the firstborn of Ephrathah the father of Bethlehem.
And*p Ashhur the father of Tekoa had two wives, Helah and Naarah.
Naarah bore him Ahuzzam, Hepher, Temeni, and Haahashtari. These were*i the sons of Naarah.
The sons of Helah were*i Zereth, Zohar, and Ethnan;
and Koz begot Anub, Zobebah, and the families of Aharhel the son of Harum.
Now*p Jabez was more honorable than his brothers, and his mother called his name Jabez, saying, “Because I bore him*i in pain.”

And Jabez called on the God of Israel saying, “Oh, that You would bless me indeed, and enlarge my territory, that Your hand would be with me, and that You would keep me*i from evil, that I may not cause pain!” So God granted him what he requested.
Chelub*p the brother of Shuhah begot Mehir, who was*i the father of Eshton.
And Eshton begot Beth-Rapha, Paseah, and Tehinnah the father of Ir-Nahash. These were*i the men of Rechah.
The*p sons of Kenaz were*i Othniel and Seraiah. The sons of Othniel were*i Hathath,
and Meonothai who*i begot Ophrah. Seraiah begot Joab the father of Ge Harashim, for they were craftsmen.
The sons of Caleb the son of Jephunneh were*i Iru, Elah, and Naam. The son of Elah was*i Kenaz.
The sons of Jehallelel were*i Ziph, Ziphah, Tiria, and Asarel.
The sons of Ezrah were*i Jether, Mered, Epher, and Jalon. And Mered’s wife bore Miriam, Shammai, and Ishbah the father of Eshtemoa.
(His wife Jehudijah bore Jered the father of Gedor, Heber the father of Sochoh, and Jekuthiel the father of Zanoah.) And these were the sons of Bithiah the daughter of Pharaoh, whom Mered took.
The*p sons of Hodiah’s wife, the sister of Naham, were*i the fathers of Keilah the Garmite and of Eshtemoa the Maachathite.
And the sons of Shimon were*i Amnon, Rinnah, Ben-Hanan, and Tilon. And the sons of Ishi were*i Zoheth and Ben-Zoheth.
The*p sons of Shelah the son of Judah were*i Er the father of Lecah, Laadah the father of Mareshah, and the families of the house of the linen workers of the house of Ashbea;
also Jokim, the men of Chozeba, and Joash; Saraph, who ruled in Moab, and Jashubi-Lehem. Now the records are ancient.
These were*i the potters and those who dwell at Netaim and Gederah; there they dwelt with the king for his work.
The Family of Simeon
The*p sons of Simeon were*i Nemuel, Jamin, Jarib, Zerah, and*i Shaul,
Shallum his son, Mibsam his son, and Mishma his son.
And the sons of Mishma were*i Hamuel his son, Zacchur his son, and Shimei his son.
Shimei had sixteen sons and six daughters; but his brothers did not have many children, nor did any of their families multiply as much as the children of Judah.
They*p dwelt at Beersheba, Moladah, Hazar Shual,
Bilhah, Ezem, Tolad,
Bethuel, Hormah, Ziklag,
Beth Marcaboth, Hazar Susim, Beth Biri, and at Shaaraim. These were*i their cities until the reign of David.
And their villages were*i Etam, Ain, Rimmon, Tochen, and Ashan—five cities—
and all the villages that were*i around these cities as far as Baal. These were*i their dwelling places, and they maintained their genealogy:
Meshobab, Jamlech, and Joshah the son of Amaziah;
Joel, and Jehu the son of Joshibiah, the son of Seraiah, the son of Asiel;
Elioenai, Jaakobah, Jeshohaiah, Asaiah, Adiel, Jesimiel, and Benaiah;
Ziza the son of Shiphi, the son of Allon, the son of Jedaiah, the son of Shimri, the son of Shemaiah—
these mentioned by name were*i leaders in their families, and their father’s house increased greatly.
So*p they went to the entrance of Gedor, as far as the east side of the valley, to seek pasture for their flocks.
And they found rich, good pasture, and the land was*i broad, quiet, and peaceful; for some Hamites formerly lived there.

These*p recorded by name came in the days of Hezekiah king of Judah; and they attacked their tents and the Meunites who were found there, and utterly destroyed them, as it is to this day. So they dwelt in their place, because there*i was*i pasture for their flocks there.
Now some*i of them, five hundred men of the sons of Simeon, went to Mount Seir, having as their captains Pelatiah, Neariah, Rephaiah, and Uzziel, the sons of Ishi.
And they defeated the rest of the Amalekites who had escaped. They have dwelt there to this day.
1 Chronicles 5
The Family of Reuben

Now*p the sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel— he was*i indeed the firstborn, but because he defiled his father’s bed, his birthright was given to the sons of Joseph, the son of Israel, so that the genealogy is not listed according to the birthright;
yet Judah prevailed over his brothers, and from him came*i a ruler, although the birthright was Joseph’s—
the sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel were Hanoch, Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi.
The*p sons of Joel were*i Shemaiah his son, Gog his son, Shimei his son,
Micah his son, Reaiah his son, Baal his son,
and Beerah his son, whom Tiglath-Pileser king of Assyria carried into captivity. He was*i leader of the Reubenites.
And his brethren by their families, when the genealogy of their generations was registered: the chief, Jeiel, and Zechariah,
and Bela the son of Azaz, the son of Shema, the son of Joel, who dwelt in Aroer, as far as Nebo and Baal Meon.
Eastward they settled as far as the entrance of the wilderness this side of the River Euphrates, because their cattle had multiplied in the land of Gilead.
Now*p in the days of Saul they made war with the Hagrites, who fell by their hand; and they dwelt in their tents throughout the entire area*i east of Gilead.
The Family of Gad
And*p the children of Gad dwelt next to them in the land of Bashan as far as Salcah:
Joel was*i the chief, Shapham the next, then Jaanai and Shaphat in Bashan,
and their brethren of their father’s house: Michael, Meshullam, Sheba, Jorai, Jachan, Zia, and Eber—seven in*i all.*i
These were*i the children of Abihail the son of Huri, the son of Jaroah, the son of Gilead, the son of Michael, the son of Jeshishai, the son of Jahdo, the son of Buz;
Ahi the son of Abdiel, the son of Guni, was*i chief of their father’s house.
And the*i Gadites*i dwelt in Gilead, in Bashan and in its villages, and in all the common-lands of Sharon within their borders.
All these were registered by genealogies in the days of Jotham king of Judah, and in the days of Jeroboam king of Israel.

The*p sons of Reuben, the Gadites, and half the tribe of Manasseh had*i forty-four thousand seven hundred and sixty valiant men, men able to bear shield and sword, to shoot with the bow, and skillful in war, who went to war.
They made war with the Hagrites, Jetur, Naphish, and Nodab.

And they were helped against them, and the Hagrites were delivered into their hand, and all who were*i with them, for they cried out to God in the battle. He heeded their prayer, because they put their trust in Him.
Then they took away their livestock—fifty thousand of their camels, two hundred and fifty thousand of their sheep, and two thousand of their donkeys—also one hundred thousand of their men;
for many fell dead, because the war was*i God’s. And they dwelt in their place until the captivity.
The Family of Manasseh (East)
So*p the children of the half-tribe of Manasseh dwelt in the land. Their numbers*i increased from Bashan to Baal Hermon, that is, to Senir, or Mount Hermon.
These were*i the heads of their fathers’ houses: Epher, Ishi, Eliel, Azriel, Jeremiah, Hodaviah, and Jahdiel. They were mighty men of valor, famous men, and*i heads of their fathers’ houses.
And*p they were unfaithful to the God of their fathers, and played the harlot after the gods of the peoples of the land, whom God had destroyed before them.

So the God of Israel stirred up the spirit of Pul king of Assyria, that is, Tiglath-Pileser king of Assyria. He carried the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh into captivity. He took them to Halah, Habor, Hara, and the river of Gozan to this day.
1 Chronicles 6
The Family of Levi
The*p sons of Levi were*i Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
The sons of Kohath were*i Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.
The children of Amram were*i Aaron, Moses, and Miriam. And the sons of Aaron were*i Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
Eleazar begot Phinehas, and*i Phinehas begot Abishua;
Abishua begot Bukki, and Bukki begot Uzzi;
Uzzi begot Zerahiah, and Zerahiah begot Meraioth;
Meraioth begot Amariah, and Amariah begot Ahitub;
Ahitub begot Zadok, and Zadok begot Ahimaaz;
Ahimaaz begot Azariah, and Azariah begot Johanan;
Johanan begot Azariah (it was he who ministered as priest in the temple that Solomon built in Jerusalem);
Azariah begot Amariah, and Amariah begot Ahitub;
Ahitub begot Zadok, and Zadok begot Shallum;
Shallum begot Hilkiah, and Hilkiah begot Azariah;
Azariah begot Seraiah, and Seraiah begot Jehozadak.
Jehozadak went into*i captivity*i when the Lord*s carried Judah and Jerusalem into captivity by the hand of Nebuchadnezzar.
The*p sons of Levi were*i Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
These are the names of the sons of Gershon: Libni and Shimei.
The sons of Kohath were*i Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.
The sons of Merari were*i Mahli and Mushi. Now these are*i the families of the Levites according to their fathers:
Of Gershon were*i Libni his son, Jahath his son, Zimmah his son,
Joah his son, Iddo his son, Zerah his son, and*i Jeatherai his son.
The sons of Kohath were*i Amminadab his son, Korah his son, Assir his son,
Elkanah his son, Ebiasaph his son, Assir his son,
Tahath his son, Uriel his son, Uzziah his son, and Shaul his son.
The sons of Elkanah were*i Amasai and Ahimoth.
As*i for*i Elkanah, the sons of Elkanah were*i Zophai his son, Nahath his son,
Eliab his son, Jeroham his son, and*i Elkanah his son.
The sons of Samuel were*i Joel the firstborn, and Abijah the second.
The sons of Merari were*i Mahli, Libni his son, Shimei his son, Uzzah his son,
Shimea his son, Haggiah his son, and*i Asaiah his son.
Musicians in the House of the Lord
Now*p these are the men whom David appointed over the service of song in the house of the Lord,*s after the ark came to rest.

They were ministering with music before the dwelling place of the tabernacle of meeting, until Solomon had built the house of the Lord*s in Jerusalem, and they served in their office according to their order.
And*p these are*i the ones who ministered with their sons: Of the sons of the Kohathites were*i Heman the singer, the son of Joel, the son of Samuel,
the son of Elkanah, the son of Jeroham, the son of Eliel, the son of Toah,
the son of Zuph, the son of Elkanah, the son of Mahath, the son of Amasai,
the son of Elkanah, the son of Joel, the son of Azariah, the son of Zephaniah,
the son of Tahath, the son of Assir, the son of Ebiasaph, the son of Korah,
the son of Izhar, the son of Kohath, the son of Levi, the son of Israel.
And his brother Asaph, who stood at his right hand, was*i Asaph the son of Berachiah, the son of Shimea,
the son of Michael, the son of Baaseiah, the son of Malchijah,
the son of Ethni, the son of Zerah, the son of Adaiah,
the son of Ethan, the son of Zimmah, the son of Shimei,
the son of Jahath, the son of Gershon, the son of Levi.
Their*p brethren, the sons of Merari, on the left hand, were*i Ethan the son of Kishi, the son of Abdi, the son of Malluch,
the son of Hashabiah, the son of Amaziah, the son of Hilkiah,
the son of Amzi, the son of Bani, the son of Shamer,
the son of Mahli, the son of Mushi, the son of Merari, the son of Levi.
And*p their brethren, the Levites, were*i appointed to every kind of service of the tabernacle of the house of God.
The Family of Aaron

But*p Aaron and his sons offered sacrifices on the altar of burnt offering and on the altar of incense, for all the work of the Most Holy Place,*i and to make atonement for Israel, according to all that Moses the servant of God had commanded.
Now these are*i the sons of Aaron: Eleazar his son, Phinehas his son, Abishua his son,
Bukki his son, Uzzi his son, Zerahiah his son,
Meraioth his son, Amariah his son, Ahitub his son,
Zadok his son, and*i Ahimaaz his son.
Dwelling Places of the Levites
Now*p these are*i their dwelling places throughout their settlements in their territory, for they were given*i by lot to the sons of Aaron, of the family of the Kohathites:
They gave them Hebron in the land of Judah, with its surrounding common-lands.
But the fields of the city and its villages they gave to Caleb the son of Jephunneh.
And to the sons of Aaron they gave one*i of*i the cities of refuge, Hebron; also Libnah with its common-lands, Jattir, Eshtemoa with its common-lands,
